intro: Cyrtandra platyphylla var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically has smooth, dark green leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
